description: From abate (“to enter without right after the owner dies and before the heir takes over”) +‎ -or. From Anglo-Norman.

entries.meaning: (law) a person who, without right, enters into a freehold on the death of the last possessor, before the heir or devisee [Mid 16th century.]

description: From abate (“do away with”) +‎ -or. From Middle English, from Old French.

entries.meaning: (law) one who abates, ends, or does away with a nuisance [Late 16th century.]
